faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The course will introduce application of empirical analysis on state and enterprise level and give knowledge about statistical and econometric methods used in analysing economic problems, the choice of analysis methods (descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing, analysis of variance, time series analysis and regression analysis), interpretation and formal presentation of results. The course acquaints students with principles of classical econometric modelling, estimation and analysis of regression model, and interpretation of results. In order to give practical competence, econometric project will be composed to solve economic problems formulated by the students.
description.et: Õppeaines tutvustatakse empiirilise analüüsi korraldamise võtteid riigi ja ettevõtte tasandil ning saadakse teadmisi majandusprobleemide analüüsimisel kasutatavatest statistilistest meetoditest ja ökonomeetrilistest meetoditest, analüüsimeetodite valikust (kirjeldav statistika, indeksiteooria, hüpoteeside testimine, keskväärtuste võrdlemine, aegridade ja nähtustevaheliste seoste analüüs), tulemuste sisulisest tõlgendamisest ja vormistamisest. Õppeaines on võimalik saada teadmisi klassikalise ökonomeetrilise modelleerimise alustest, ühevõrrandilise regressioonimudeli hindamisest, analüüsimisest ning tulemuste sisulisest tõlgendamisest Ökonomeetrilise meetodite praktilise kasutamise oskuste süvendamiseks koostatakse ökonomeetriline projekt üliõpilaste poolt püstitatud sisuliste majandusprobleemide lahendamiseks.

objectives.en: Enables students to learn, how to set up research problems, which can be solved with the help of statistical and econometric methods; to acquire skills and experiences of using statistical and econometric methods to analyse economic and social data; to find solutions to the formulated research problems and to interpret the results.
objectives.et: Võimaldada üliõpilastel õppida püstitama uurimisprobleeme, millede lahendamisel saab kasutada statistilisi ja ökonomeetrilisi meetodeid ning omandada oskusi ja kogemusi statistiliste ja ökonomeetriliste meetodite kasutamiseks majandus- ja sotsiaalprotsesse iseloomustavate andmete analüüsimisel, püstitatud uurimisprobleemidele lahenduste leidmisel ning uurimistulemuste sisulisel tõlgendamisel.

learning_outcomes.en:
After taking the course the student has acquired the following skills and competencies: 
- Skill to formulate research problems, which can be solved with the help of statistical and econometric methods.
- Skill to find necessary and suitable data for analysis, to systematize and prepare data for statistical and econometric analysis.
- Knowledge and skills of the main statistical and econometric data analysis methods and their application.
- Skill to interpret and generalize the results of statistical and econometric analysis, and to analyse the accordance of results to the formulated research problem.
learning_outcomes.et:
Oskuse formuleerida probleeme, milledele lahenduste otsimisel saab kasutada statistilisi ja ökonomeetrilisi meetodeid.
Oskuse leida analüüsiks vajalikke ja sobivaid andmeid, neid süstematiseerida ja ette valmistada andmeid statistiliseks ja ökonomeetriliseks andmeanalüüsiks.
Teadmised ja oskused olulisematest statistilistest ja ökonomeetrilistest andmeanalüüsi meetoditest, nende rakendamist ning tulemuste sisulisest tõlgendamisest.
Oskuse sisuliselt tõlgendada statistilise ja ökonomeetrilise analüüsi tulemusi, neid üldistada ning analüüsida tulemuste vastavust püstitatud uurimisküsimustele.

description.et:
Different exercises after computer labs in statistics. 
Feedback in terms of points obtained will be provided in the study information system during 7 days after handing in the exercises. If more detailed (personal) feedback is wanted, students should contact the lecturer of the computer lab.

Econometric project. 
Feedback will be presented verbally in seminars where students present their work, in the stages of project plan and preliminary version of a project. Feedback to the final version of the project will be provided in written form at latest in 2 weeks after handing in the project, in the form of emails sent to the students containing the main advantages and disadvantages of the projects.

Small quizzes in lectures. 
Feedback will be given in 7 days after conducting the exercise, containing the points gathered and the solution expected.

Final exam on all the covered subjects. 
Feedback will contain the score obtained, provided via study information system in 7 days after the second exam date.

grade_preconditions.et:
The possibility to participate is given to those students, who have gathered at least 15 points from quizzes and home work assignments in statistics. Points for econometric project are not counted here. 
To get a positive final result, at least 50% of the exam should be gained.

grade_evaluation.et: This course will end with final examination. The final grade of this course will consist of the following parts: homework in statistics (20%), econometric project (15%), quizzes (10%), final exam (55%).

debt_elimination.et: In agreement with lecturers, only if has participated in the studies and has submitted some of quizzes or homework .

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
Aczel, Amir D. Complete Business Statistics. Irwin, 1989
Gujarati, Damodar. Essentials of Econometrics. McGraw-Hill, Inc., 1992
resources.recommended_materials:
Dougherty, Ch. Introduction to Econometrics. Oxforr University Press, 2002
Wooldridge J.M., Introductory Econometrics. A Modern Approach, Thomson, South Western, 2003D. 
Gujarati, Basic Econometrics. McGraw-Hill Book Company, 1995
A.H. Studenmund, Using Econometrics: A Practical Guide, Addison-Wesley, 1997

description.et: Introduction to the course, descriptive statistics
Statistical distribution, confidence interval, hypotheses testing
T-test and analysis of variance with SPSS
Introduction to regression analysis, econometric project
Estimation and analysis of regression model
Presentation of econometric project plan (depending on registration, on 6.November or 8.November)
Functional forms of regression models. Stability of the results.
Presentation of econometric projects (depending on registration, on 4.December or 6.December)
